habitat_description:
This species is found on the western slope foothills of the Sierra Nevada of California; from approximately the lower Merced River Canyon in Mariposa County to north of the American River in Placer County (Jockusch et al. 1998; Stebbins 2003). No egg deposition sites have been described for this species and eggs are possibly laid well underground (Lannoo 2005). 
Preferred habitat is mixed pine-oak woodland and chaparral communities of the foothills of the Sierra Nevada. Sometimes, in low elevation areas of the foothills characterized by extreme heat and drought in the summer (Lannoo 2005; Green et al. 2013).

Cover is provided by metamorphic rocks, bark rubble, fallen logs, generally in areas that receive direct sunlight during winter months. Vegetation cover is provided by canyon live oak, bigleaf maple, California bay, and Douglas fir, while ferns and mosses cover the ground (Lannoo 2005).
